content:
Coaches have a significant responsibility in ensuring that their student-athletes remain eligible for Division I competition. They are responsible for monitoring their athletes' academic progress and ensuring that they are meeting the NCAA's eligibility requirements. This includes monitoring their grades and ensuring that they are making satisfactory progress towards their degree, as well as ensuring that they are meeting the NCAA's core course requirements. 

Coaches also play a role in providing academic support to their athletes, such as tutoring and study halls. They must work closely with academic advisors and compliance officers to ensure that their athletes are meeting all NCAA rules and regulations. 

Ultimately, coaches can be held accountable for any violations of NCAA eligibility rules by their athletes. Therefore, they have a significant incentive to ensure that their athletes remain eligible and meet all academic requirements.
